channel.title: Stories from bldgblog.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best bldgblog.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: Tax Incentives And The Human Imagination
item.description: It would be interesting to look at locations of the American popular imagination, as seen in movies and TV, mapped against regional tax breaks for the film industry.

item.title: Norwegian Dream Tunnels
item.description: To get back and forth from Troms√∏ to its local airport by car, you have to pass through a sprawling underground tunnel network, complete with at least one subterranean roundabout carved into the roots of the mountain, a journey that, for someone newly arrived and jet-lagged like myself, seemed surreally endless

item.title: The Ghost of Cognition Past, or Thinking Like An Algorithm
item.description: What if, instead of a human producer, a machine-learning algorithm had been tasked with analyzing Netflix consumer data and generating an idea for a new TV show?
item.kicker: STOP ME IF YOU'VE HEARD THIS ONE BEFORE

item.title: Warnings Along the Inundation Line
item.description: After the tsunami in 2011, one of the most ominous details revealed about the coast where it struck, for those of us not familiar with the region, was that a series of warning stones stand there overlooking the sea, carved with sayings such as, "Do not build your homes below this point!"

item.title: The Coming Amnesia
item.description: There will be a point, in the very far future, at which all galaxies will be so far apart that they will no longer be visible from one another.
